meanings.definition: zizzles (verb): to make a buzzing or hissing sound
meanings.sent1: The bee zizzles around the garden.
meanings.sent2: The old radio zizzles with static.
meanings.sent3: The zizzles of the mosquito kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air zizzles like electricity.
meanings.sent5: The campfire zizzles as the wood crackles and pops.

meanings.definition: zizzles (noun): a buzzing or hissing noise
meanings.sent1: The zizzles of the cicadas filled the summer air.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the distant zizzles of a car engine.
meanings.sent3: The zizzles of the soda can being opened made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent4: The zizzles of the wind through the trees was calming.
meanings.sent5: The zizzles of the espresso machine signaled the start of the busy morning.

meanings.definition: zizzles (adjective): having a buzzing or hissing quality
meanings.sent1: The zizzles sound of the broken fan was annoying.
meanings.sent2: The zizzles sensation of the fizzy drink tickled my nose.
meanings.sent3: The zizzles noise of the faulty microphone made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The zizzles atmosphere of the forest at night was eerie.
meanings.sent5: The zizzles feeling of excitement before the concert was palpable.
